name: Alpha Commander
description:
The Alpha Commander is a heavily-armored and supercharged variant of the Brood Commander, boasting increased health and heightened aggression.

With a health pool of 1000 and the ability to summon Alpha Warriors, these fast-moving and relentless enemies are lethal up close.

Like Brood Commanders, they enter a berserk state when beheaded, gaining speed and attack power briefly before expiring. Maiming their legs to slow them or engaging at range with high-damage weapons is critical for survival.

name: Alpha Warrior
description:
The Alpha Warrior is a faster and deadlier variant of the Warrior, exclusively summoned by Alpha Commanders on Impossible difficulty and above.

While identical to Warriors in behavior, their increased speed allows them to relentlessly pursue and attack Helldivers.

Upon losing their head, Alpha Warriors gain heightened aggression and can deal significant damage before bleeding out.

Helldivers are advised to ensure they are fully dispatched, or cripple their legs to slow them down.

name: Bile Warrior
description:
The Bile Warrior is a medium-sized Terminid variant of the Warrior, distinguished by its volatile bile sack and unstable body chemistry.

Believed to be a sub-adult form of the Bile Titan, these creatures appear on Challenging difficulty and higher, releasing a deadly bile explosion upon death.

While their combat behavior mirrors standard Warriors, Helldivers must maintain a safe distance to avoid their explosive demise, making ranged tactics essential for survival.

name: Hive Guard
description:
The Hive Guard is a medium-sized Terminid equipped with medium armor on its front, appearing on Easy difficulty and higher.

Larger than the Warrior, it plays a defensive role, often protecting bug nests or escorting high-value Terminids like Brood Commanders and Chargers.

When under fire, Hive Guards can 'hunker down,' forming a stationary shield wall with their armored head and claws, protecting smaller Terminids behind them.

Their armor can be bypassed by flanking or aiming at gaps, while grenades and high-penetration weapons can effectively dispatch them.

Hive Guards may briefly enter a berserk state upon decapitation, blindly rushing forward before expiring.

name: Behemoth
description:
The Behemoth is a heavily-armored variation of the Charger, distinguishable by its elongated horn-like head armor.

Found as Elimination Targets or Shuttle Bay guardians on Medium difficulty, they also spawn randomly at higher difficulties alongside regular Chargers.

Behemoths have increased health and armor resistance, making their unprotected abdomen less vulnerable to damage.

They are more resilient than standard Chargers and frequently enter a berserk state before succumbing to their wounds.

name: Spore Charger
description:
The Spore Charger is a heavily-armored evolution of the Charger, distinguished by the spore fog it generates and its bright-green bile sacs.

Its fog shroud obscures vision and masks its movements, making it a dangerous ambush predator.

Despite its shroud, the Spore Charger retains the same weaknesses as regular Chargers, including its vulnerable rear abdomen and susceptibility to explosives.

However, killing it with an explosion scatters corrosive bile in the surrounding area, causing damage over time and slowing nearby Helldivers.

name: Scavenger
description:
The Scavenger, an adolescent form of the Warrior, sits at the bottom of the Terminid food chain and is ubiquitous across various planets and difficulty levels.

Though individually weak and largely harmless, Scavengers can become surprisingly dangerous when encountered in packs. A Helldiver caught amidst a group of these creatures may find them more threatening than initially anticipated. Additionally, if given the opportunity, Scavengers can release a cloud of Pheromone Spores, signaling the presence of hostiles to other nearby Terminids.

name: Impaler
description: The Impaler is a colossal, heavily-armored Terminid with a distinctive and formidable mutation: its head is composed of three lethal tentacles that can burrow deep into the ground and reemerge up to several dozen meters away.

name: Warrior
description:
The Warrior represents the evolutionary advancement from the Scavenger and precedes the transformation into a Brood Commander, appearing at any difficulty level.

Armed only with razor-sharp claws, these light-armored enemies rely on surprise tactics, such as burrowing underground to ambush Helldivers.

Warriors are fast, aggressive, and often attack in packs, utilizing flanking maneuvers to encircle their targets.

When beheaded, they enter a berserk state, blindly charging at their last known target with heightened aggression before expiring.

name: Hunter
description:
The Hunter, a medium-sized Terminid like the Warrior, emerges on Medium difficulty and higher.

Employing tactics from its adolescent stage, the Pouncer, Hunters use their wings to leap great distances, stunning Helldivers and executing flank maneuvers to gain the upper hand.

name: Stalker
description: The Stalker is a large-sized Terminid that originates from a Stalker Lair. It appears to be a mutated version of the Hunter, equipped with camouflage capabilities and enhanced strength. There are historical reports suggesting that this strain of Terminid was present during the First Galactic War, although there is no documented evidence of their camouflage abilities from that time.

name: Bile Spewer
description:
The Bile Spewer, a Terminid with moderate armor and size, appears on Medium difficulty and higher. It represents the adult form and third stage in a four-stage evolutionary sequence, following the Bile Spitter and Nursing Spewer and preceding the Bile Titan.

Bile Spewers discharge streams of highly corrosive acid known as 'Bile', which can impede Helldivers' movements and prove extremely lethal upon prolonged exposure. On Extreme difficulty and higher, Bile Spewers gain the capability to launch a mortar-like volley of bile into the air, significantly enhancing their range and lethality.

name: Charger
description:
The Charger is a large, heavily-armored Terminid that begins appearing as an Elimination Target on Medium difficulty and becomes more frequent at higher levels.

Known for its devastating charges, which can concuss, trample, or even launch Helldivers, the Charger also uses its claws in close-range combat.

While heavily armored, its rear abdomen is unprotected and vulnerable to sustained fire. Chargers can enter a berserk state upon receiving lethal damage, continuing to attack before succumbing to their wounds.

name: Brood Commander
description:
The Brood Commander, a heavily-armored Terminid and variant of the Warrior, represents the nearly-extinct Terminid Leadership Caste.

It can summon Warriors and Hive Guards, or trigger bug breaches to overwhelm Helldivers with swarms.

Despite its light armor, the Brood Commander boasts high durability and can enter a berserk state if its head is destroyed, briefly gaining speed and attack power before expiring.

Destroying its legs or claws can slow it significantly, and stagger effects can disrupt its pheromone signals.

name: Bile Titan
description:
The Bile Titan, a colossal and heavily-armored Terminid, represents the ultimate growth stage of a Bile Warrior. It appears on Challenging difficulty as an Elimination Target and becomes increasingly common as the difficulty escalates.

Despite its immense size, the Bile Titan can rapidly close distances, dousing Helldivers with its deadly bile. Those in close proximity also risk being crushed or impaled by its massive claws.

name: Shrieker
description: Shriekers are moderate-sized, flying Terminids characterized by their large wingspans. They typically travel in large flocks and employ dive tactics to swoop down and swipe at Helldivers.
